description:
Variation of condition 2 (approved plans) attached to planning permission 2019/1628 dated 28/08/2019 for the 'replacement of façade of north west part of building, including remodelling at corner of Hoxton Street and Nuttall Street; elevational alterations to include replacement fenestration on southern and eastern elevations; new entrance door to listed facade; and erection of a roof extension to create an additional 3 bedroom dwelling (Use Class C3)
The effect of the variation would amend the roof form of the extension, retain the existing bay feature on the front elevation (west), install a canopy of the west elevation and make alterations to windows and elevation detailing.
decision_conditions: <p>The development and works which provide public benefits in the form of heritage benefits (which help weigh in favour of the approved scheme) as detailed in the approved Design and Access Statement, drawings and documents shall be undertaken prior to occupation of the building.&nbsp; For the avoidance of doubt these are primarily considered to be:</p><p><br></p><p>a)&nbsp;The installation of the two hardwood entrance doors to the listed facade detailed in Section 2.7 of the submitted Design and Access Statement.</p><p>b) The brickwork repairs detailed in Section 4.0 of the submitted Design and Access Statement.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the public benefits, including the heritage benefits, of the approved scheme are secured and in accordance with Sections 16 and 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan, March 2016 Policies 7.8 Heritage Assets and Archaeology and 7.9 Heritage-led Regeneration; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>Full details of all the materials to be used on the external surfaces of the building, including, but not limited to, all new brick types and all roofing tiles and materials, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before any work commences on site. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to preserving and enhancing the character and appearance of the Conservation Area in conformity with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan, March 2016 Policies 7.8 Heritage Assets and Archaeology and 7.9 Heritage-led Regeneration; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, plumbing, pipes, flues, vents or ductwork shall be fixed on the external faces of the building other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to preserving and enhancing the character and appearance of the Conservation Area in conformity with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan, March 2016 Policies 7.8 Heritage Assets and Archaeology and 7.9 Heritage-led Regeneration; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>The Development hereby permitted must be begun by not later than 28/08/2021, which is the expiration of three years beginning with the date of the previously approved consent (2019/1628).</p><p><br></p><p><span style="font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; white-space: pre-wrap;">REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).</span><br></p>

<p>Before the fifth floor unit hereby approved is occupied, space shall be made
available internally for the secure parking of 2 cycle stands at ground floor level. The
cycle parking spaces shall be retained in perpetuity thereafter.
</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that a reasonable provision is made within the site for the
parking of bicycles in the interests of discouraging car use, relieving congestion in
surrounding streets and improving highway conditions in general</p>

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved a minimum of 2
Swift nesting bricks and/or boxes shall be provided at or close to eaves level of the
development hereby approved. The bricks/boxes shall be retained thereafter in
perpetuity.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: in the interests of biodiversity.</p>

<p>All non-Combined Heat and Power (CHP) space and hot water fossil fuel (or
equivalent hydrocarbon based fuel) boilers installed as part of the development
hereby approved shall achieve dry NOx emission levels equivalent to or less than 40
mg/kWh.
</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To protect air quality and people's health by ensuring that the production
of air pollutants, such as nitrogen dioxide and particulate matter, are kept to a
minimum as a result of the development and to contribute towards the maintenance
or to prevent further exceedances of National Air Quality Objectives.</p>

<p>Prior to the occupation of the fifth floor roof extension the prior approval given
under application 2018/4001 shall be implemented.
</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To protect the amenity of future residents from the existing commercial
uses</p>

<p>Before the relevant part of the works starts, proposals for the method and extent of brickwork cleaning and tinting shall be approved in writing with the Local Planning Authority and be carried out accordingly.&nbsp; The required detail shall include 1 metre square sample panels, showing the proposed cleaning and tinting method.&nbsp; No other cleaning and tinting of brickwork is authorised by this consent without prior approval of the details.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to preserving and enhancing the character and appearance of the Conservation Area in conformity with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan, March 2016 Policies 7.8 Heritage Assets and Archaeology and 7.9 Heritage-led Regeneration; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>Notwithstanding the approved drawings, plans and documents, detailed drawings and full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of works.&nbsp; The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved:</p><p>a) Details of all the proposed new windows in the form of a manufacturer’s illustration and specification showing the glazing pattern, material, design, colour and profiles of the frames and depths of the glazing units or suitably scaled drawings providing the same information.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to preserving and enhancing the character and appearance of the Conservation Area in conformity with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan, March 2016 Policies 7.8 Heritage Assets and Archaeology and 7.9 Heritage-led Regeneration; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>No new grilles, satellite dishes, aerials, meter boxes, security alarms, lighting, security or other cameras or other fixtures or plant shall be mounted on the external faces or roof of the building other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to preserving and enhancing the character and appearance of the Conservation Area in conformity with Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan, March 2016 Policies 7.8 Heritage Assets and Archaeology and 7.9 Heritage-led Regeneration; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.<br></p>
